metadata.name: Gone at the most beautiful
metadata.description:
Mono no aware (物の哀れ), literally "the pathos of things", is a Japanese idiom for the awareness of impermanence. Mono no aware is the core concept of Japanese traditional aesthetics, which is the emotional immersion in foreign objects: cherry blossoms fall, cicadas cry, lovers look back... From this, we realize that things are impermanent, and the most beautiful is only in an instant.

1904x2380 pixel
